title.narrative: NORMATIVE FRAMEWORK & CAPACITY DEVELOP.

description.narrative: Legal framework and capacities to detect, refer and respond to violence are developed and implemented with cross-sectoral coordination, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, an increased number of boys and girls benefit from child protection interventions aimed at preventing, adequately detecting, referring and responding to violence and abuse

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Legal framework and capacities to detect, refer and respond to violence are developed and implemented with cross-sectoralcoordination

description.narrative: Justice for children system reform, is part of the wider Government Rule of Law reform agenda, initiated with commitment of three key ministers to invest in improved legislative framework, procedures, practices and capacities of the justice for children system and to enhance the monitoring system and the access to justice of children in the justice system. The Justice for Children Law, governing proceedings affecting children in the justice system, is being revised to set the basis for a new improved system in line with International and European standards and norms conducive to child rights. | Status:Met | As-of Date:15/01/2021
